file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 21-22-06-04 - CONFIG-1 - PASSENGER CABIN DISTRIBUTION - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER CABIN DISTRIBUTION - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the conditioned-air supply ducts. B. The conditioned-air supply ducts are installed in the passenger cabin. C. The conditioned-air supply ducts interconnect the ducts, under the passenger cabin floor, with the floor outlets. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) CONDITIONED-AIR SUPPLY DUCT - RE- 21-22-06-000-801-A EMB-145 MOVAL ACFT MODEL(S) CONDITIONED-AIR SUPPLY DUCT - IN- 21-22-06-400-801-A EMB-145 STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 21-22-06 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-22-06-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 2. CONDITIONED-AIR SUPPLY DUCT - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to remove the supply ducts. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 241 241AF Passenger cabin floor 242 242BF Passenger cabin floor 251 251AF Passenger cabin floor 251 251CF Passenger cabin floor 251 251JF Passenger cabin floor 252 252BF Passenger cabin floor 252 252AF Passenger cabin floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-011-A (1) Remove the applicable passenger-cabin floor panel (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 21-22-06 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal of the Duct Assembly (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-011-A (1) Remove the four screws (1) and washers (2). (2) Remove the panel (3). (3) Remove the ten screws (4). (4) Remove the decal (5) and adhesive tape (6). (5) Remove the conditioned-air supply duct (7). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 21-22-06 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

PANEL 4. SCREW (10) DET. C INSTALL THE ADHESIVE TAPE ON THIS SURFACE C 7. SUPPY DUCT 6. TAPE (EXTERNALLY) 5. DECAL DET. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-22-06-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 3. CONDITIONED-AIR SUPPLY DUCT - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the conditioned-air supply duct. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 241 241AF Passenger cabin floor 242 242BF Passenger cabin floor 251 251AF Passenger cabin floor 251 251CF Passenger cabin floor 251 251JF Passenger cabin floor 252 252BF Passenger cabin floor 252 252AF Passenger cabin floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) KB 42/75 mm Tape, gray AR PE43035-1 Decal AR OT-57 CW Orcon Adhesive Tape AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 21-22-06 Page 5 of 6 Rev 50 - Apr 29/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation of the Duct Assembly (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-011-A (1) Apply adhesive tape OT-57 CW on the lower portion of the conditioned-air supply duct to seal the duct and the supply duct together. (2) Install conditioned-air supply duct (7). (3) Seal the duct with adhesive tape (6) and install decal (5). (4) Install ten screws (4). (5) Install panel (3). (6) Install four washers (4) with four screws (1). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-011-A (1) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations (Section 6) of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (2) Install the applicable passenger-cabin floor panel (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 21-22-06 Page 6 of 6 Rev 50 - Apr 29/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
